headline.print_headline: Verdict Repudiates Notion Of Youth as Legal Defense
headline.seo: Rutgers Verdict Repudiates Notion of Youth as a Defense
headline.main: Rutgers Verdict Repudiates Notion of Youth as Defense

docs.snippet: Lawyers said the verdict in the case against Dharun Ravi was a sign that a “jerky kid” defense may no longer hold as much sway....

keywords.value: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Lawyers say the guilty verdict in the case against Dharun Ravi was a sign that a 'jerky kid' defense may no longer hold as much sway; say it gives new potential to hate-crime prosecutions for cyberbullying and digital spying; Ravi was convicted of bias intimidation, invasion of privacy and other charges for using a webcam to spy on his roommate Tyler Clementi, who later killed himself.
docs.lead_paragraph: Lawyers said the verdict in the case against Dharun Ravi was a sign that a “jerky kid” defense may no longer hold as much sway.

docs.lead_paragraph: The naming of basketball courts by colleges and universities after a former coach or donor can often leave hurt feelings and spark controversy.

headline.print_headline: Outdoor Skating, Winter’s Joy in Canada, Feels Effects of Changing Climate

headline.main: Outdoor Skating, Winter’s Joy in Canada, Feels Effects of Changing Climate

headline.print_headline: Belarussian Is Executed Over Attack On Subway

headline.main: Belarussian Is Executed Over Attack on Subway

docs.lead_paragraph: Vladislav Kovalyov, 26, was convicted of helping his childhood friend carry out the April 2011 bombing, but human rights groups have cast serious doubt on the verdict.

headline.print_headline: Two Deadly Explosions Strike Near Government Agencies in Syrian Capital
headline.seo: 2 Blasts Strike Near Government Agencies in Damascus
headline.main: Two Blasts Strike Near Security Agencies in Syria

docs.snippet: Explosions hit intelligence and security buildings in Damascus, the capital, killing or wounding dozens of civilians and security personnel, Syrian state news media reported....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Two large explosions, believed to be car bombs, strike in the Syrian capital, Damascus, hitting intelligence and security buildings in busy sections of the city and killing or wounding dozens of civilians and security personnel; bombings in Pres Bashar al-Assad’s seat of power shock residents who have enjoyed relative calm during the yearlong uprising, and stand as a direct challenge to the government’s claims that it is close to restoring order.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and Hala Droubi from Jidda, Saudi Arabia.

docs.lead_paragraph: Explosions hit intelligence and security buildings in Damascus, the capital, killing or wounding dozens of civilians and security personnel, Syrian state news media reported.

headline.seo: Tibetans Protest in Northwest China After Farmer’s Death
